page.title: 09SHEEP FARMING
page.content: Sheep give us mutton and wool. They need dipping twice a year for sheep scab and other diseases. Sheep scab are little mites which cause sheep to rub against tree trunks and fences and then the wool starts to come off. Sheep are sheared once a year usually between May and July. It is now mostly done by an electric shearing machine. The ewes or female sheep lamb once a year,mostly between January and May. If a ewe rejects a lamb or if it dies it is called a kade and needs to be hand reared . We keep Suffolk, Suffolk-Cross and Mules. On our farm there are about seventy-five sheep and lambs. One acre of land supports four sheep and eight lambs.
